subsections.title: Base URL & Version Header
subsections.notes: All requests must include an up-to-date cal-api-version header.

subsections.title: Authentication Methods

methods.useCase: Platform customers managing managed users, creating client webhooks, or any Teams/Orgs resources
Acting on behalf of a managed user (schedules, event types, bookings)
methods.implementation: Authorization: Bearer <access-token> (valid 60 min; refresh token valid 1 year)

subsections.tip: Platform plans do not use API keys; rely on OAuth or managed-user tokens instead.

subsections.title: Rate Limits

headers.name: X-RateLimit-Limit
headers.description: Max requests in the current window

headers.name: X-RateLimit-Reset
headers.description: Epoch timestamp when the window resets

subsections.notes: Exceeding the limit returns 429 Too Many Requests.

sections.title: Endpoint Catalogue
sections.note: Unless noted, prepend /v2/ and include the authentication + version header.

resources.name: Attributes
resources.description: CRUD attributes + options; assign/unassign to users

resources.name: Teams
resources.description: full team management (GET/POST/GET/{id}/DEL/PATCH) incl. sub-resources (bookings, conferencing, event-types, memberships, routing forms, member schedules)

resources.name: Bookings
resources.description: list, create, get, reschedule, cancel, confirm/decline, mark absence, reassign host, add-to-calendar

resources.name: Calendars
resources.description: save/check ICS feed, busy times, connect/disconnect Google/Outlook/Apple, check connection

resources.name: Conferencing
resources.description: connect app, OAuth URL, callback, list, set/get default, disconnect

resources.name: Slots
resources.description: availability lookup, reserve / get / update / delete reservation

resources.name: Stripe
resources.description: connect URL, save credentials, check connection

resources.name: Teams
resources.description: CRUD + sub-resources (event types, memberships, phone calls)

differences: Version header – every request now requires cal-api-version
Improved response objects – richer, more consistent JSON
New OAuth & Platform concepts – managed users, child orgs, etc
Performance & security enhancements across the board
